Articles.Content:
lol... I hate surprises...

so how long do we sit here talking about ship and such? or will you guy's have a real battle?

As it turns out I actually have a little bit of time so I can do a small scale battle but it will have to end on Sunday.

any takers?

however if my family comes down for the weekend on saturday I will have to end the match
don't have anything bigger than a fighter here... (if you don't count my modular armor test piece )
Dreks are ready to battle anyone except spartwo (no ninja'ing the weapons of my ships )
are there rules about getting the ships to the battle site?

it's an honor system, as long as they are capable of getting there legit you can hyperedit them.

EDIt: check out my new 20 ton fighter. It can bounce a Battleship-Grade Missile

9 ton Helios Torpedo missile hit rear, that's the nosecone sticking in the back.

Edited October 9, 2013 by zekes
Seriously,armor isn't that important it drives up part count and only protects against medium-low caliber rounds.Now negligible loss that's something.
you... might want to consider therapy for your um slight problem...

Seriously,armor isn't that important it drives up part count and only protects against medium-low caliber rounds.Now negligible loss that's something.

No, in fact this new way of building i think is better. With only a small (+50-100) parts added and 10 tons, the Drek is 10 times better. I'd pay that price again. And armor has finally become strong enough to protect big ships against fighters (which cause the most damage to larger ships as they go first).

For example, my new fighter is only 20 tons, has 3100 m/s D/V with 4 ION engines, RCS to propel it in combat, and can bounce all but the largest capital ship rounds. It carries 6 HV missiles, which are useless against larger ships, but are effective against other fighters, and is capable of modification to carry 1 large Heavy Caliber round and 4 HV missiles.

In short, I like armor now that it's useful. But yes, i agree it is mostly about negligible loss.

And armor has finally become strong enough to protect big ships against fighters (which cause the most damage to larger ships as they go first).

For example, my new fighter is only 20 tons, has 3100 m/s D/V with 4 ION engines, RCS to propel it in combat, and can bounce all but the largest capital ship rounds. It carries 6 HV missiles, which are useless against larger ships, but are effective against other fighters, and is capable of modification to carry 1 large Heavy Caliber round and 4 HV missiles.

In short, I like armor now that it's useful. But yes, i agree it is mostly about negligible loss.

Yes armor but not to the extent of having a part count in excess of 500 for a 10% higher survive ability rate over craft with half that.Is there a picture not from the back I just finished reverse engineering the piranha.also part count?
